tip1: When you claim without withdrawing your liquidity remains in the mining pool.
tip2: When you withdraw, your {{baseCurrency}} is claimed and your liquidity is removed from the mining pool.
tip3: When you add liquidity, you are given pool tokens representing your position. These tokens automatically earn fees proportional to your share of the pool, and can be redeemed at any time.
tip4: Removing pool tokens converts your position back into underlying tokens at the current rate, proportional to your share of the pool. Accrued fees are included in the amounts you receive.
tip5: When you withdraw, the contract will automagically claim {{baseCurrency}} on your behalf!
tip6: Find a token by searching for its name or symbol or by pasting its address below.
tip7: Expert mode turns off the confirm transaction prompt and allows high slippage trades that often result in bad rates and lost funds.
tip8: ONLY USE THIS MODE IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
tip9: Please type the word 'confirm' to enable expert mode.
tip10: Bypasses confirmation modals and allows high slippage trades. Use at your own risk.
tip11: Your transaction will revert if the price changes unfavorably by more than this percentage.
tip15: Your transaction will revert if it is pending for more than this long.

tip22: Your transaction will revert if there is a large, unfavorable price movement before it is confirmed.
tip23: This tool will safely migrate your V1 liquidity to V2 with minimal price risk. The process is completely trustless thanks to the
tip24: It is best to deposit liquidity into {{appName}} at a price you believe is correct. If the V2 price seems incorrect, you can either make a swap to move the price or wait for someone else to do so.
tip25: You are the first liquidity provider for this pair on {{appName}}. Your liquidity will be migrated at the current V1 price. Your transaction cost also includes the gas to create the pool.
tip27: Migrate your liquidity tokens from {{oldAppName}} to {{appName}}.
tip29: Because {{appName}} uses {{symbol}} under the hood, your {{oldAppName}} {{symbol}}/{{symbol1}} liquidity cannot be migrated. You may want to remove your liquidity instead.
tip30: Output is estimated. If the price changes by more than {{allowedSlippage}}% your transaction will revert.

TokenImportedTip: Anyone can create an ERC20 token on Ethereum with any name, including creating fake versions of existing tokens and tokens that claim to represent projects that do not have a token.
TokenImportedTip1: This interface can load arbitrary tokens by token addresses. Please take extra caution and do your research when interacting with arbitrary ERC20 tokens.
TokenImportedTip2: If you purchase an arbitrary token, you may be unable to sell it back.
